pullrequest.title: Fixing the collision reporting for DART

content.raw:
I did some debugging on this failing test case and confirmed that `GetContactCount() == 1` with bullet, but after some printing, I found that while the set of contacts returned by `GetContact(0)` has two collision pointers, it doesn't have any contact points. The ContactManager doesn't publish empty contacts messages like this due to the following check:

* #!/osrf/gazebo/src/a2e24ead6b45c637436c5f38b906c5d327e4f6b1/gazebo/physics/ContactManager.cc?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default#ContactManager.cc-307:308

So there is probably a place in bullet that creates a data structure before knowing that it will actually have any contact points
content.html:
I did some debugging on this failing test case and confirmed that GetContactCount() == 1 with bullet, but after some printing, I found that while the set of contacts returned by GetContact(0) has two collision pointers, it doesn't have any contact points. The ContactManager doesn't publish empty contacts messages like this due to the following check:

  • #!/osrf/gazebo/src/a2e24ead6b45c637436c5f38b906c5d327e4f6b1/gazebo/physics/ContactManager.cc?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default#ContactManager.cc-307:308

So there is probably a place in bullet that creates a data structure before knowing that it will actually have any contact points
